column1: Shuangliao (simplified Chinese: 双辽; traditional Chinese: 雙遼; pinyin: Shuāngliáo) is a city in western Jilin
column3: bordering Liaoning and Inner Mongolia. It is under the administration of Siping City.

column5: Namusi Mongol Ethnic Township (那木斯蒙古族乡)

column1: Shuangliao is located at the confluence of the western and eastern branches of the Liao River as well as the Songliao Plain with the Horqin Grasslands (科尔沁草原). It borders Changtu County (Liaoning) and Lishu County to the south
column4: and the Horqin Left Middle and Left Back banners of Inner Mongolia. The administrative area reaches 89 km (55 mi) in north-south extent and 62 km (39 mi) in east-west width
column9: humid continental climate (Köppen Dwa). Winters are long (lasting from November to March)
column13: with a January 24-hour average temperature of −14.6 °C (5.7 °F). Spring and fall are somewhat short transitional periods
column15: but are usually dry and windy. Summers are hot and humid
column16: with a July average of 23.8 °C (74.8 °F). Over two-thirds of the annual precipitation of 474 millimetres (18.7 in) occurs from June to August. The annual mean temperature is 6.18 °C (43.1 °F)
